segment.source: MD Conversion - Manage email access with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Manage email access with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Manage email access with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Manage email access with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Use the conditional access policies for Exchange to manage access to Exchange email based on conditions you specify.
segment.target: Use the conditional access policies for Exchange to manage access to Exchange email based on conditions you specify.

segment.source: You can manage access to:
segment.target: You can manage access to:

segment.source: Microsoft Exchange On-premises
segment.target: Microsoft Exchange On-premises

segment.source: Microsoft Exchange Online
segment.target: Microsoft Exchange Online

segment.source: Exchange Online Dedicated
segment.target: Exchange Online Dedicated

segment.source: If you configure conditional access, before a user can connect to their email, the device they use must:
segment.target: If you configure conditional access, before a user can connect to their email, the device they use must:

segment.source: Be enrolled with or a domain joined PC.
segment.target: Be enrolled with or a domain joined PC.

segment.source: Register the device in Azure Active Directory (this happens automatically when the device is enrolled with (for Exchange Online only).
segment.target: Register the device in Azure Active Directory (this happens automatically when the device is enrolled with (for Exchange Online only).

segment.source: Additionally, the client Exchange ActiveSync ID must be registered with Azure Active Directory (does not apply to Windows and Windows Phone devices connecting to Exchange On-premises).
segment.target: Additionally, the client Exchange ActiveSync ID must be registered with Azure Active Directory (does not apply to Windows and Windows Phone devices connecting to Exchange On-premises).

segment.source: For a domain joined PC, you must set it to automatically register with Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: For a domain joined PC, you must set it to automatically register with Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: Conditional Access for PCs section in the Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune topic lists the full set of requirements to enable conditional access for PCs.
segment.target: Conditional Access for PCs section in the Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune topic lists the full set of requirements to enable conditional access for PCs.

segment.source: Be compliant with any compliance policies deployed to that device
segment.target: Be compliant with any compliance policies deployed to that device

segment.source: If a conditional access condition is not met, the user is presented with one of the following messages when they log in.
segment.target: If a conditional access condition is not met, the user is presented with one of the following messages when they log in.

segment.source: For mobile devices:
segment.target: For mobile devices:

segment.source: If the device is not enrolled with , or is not registered in Azure Active Directory, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app, enroll the device, activate email, which associates the device’s Exchange ActiveSync ID with the device record in Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: If the device is not enrolled with , or is not registered in Azure Active Directory, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app, enroll the device, activate email, which associates the device’s Exchange ActiveSync ID with the device record in Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: If the device is not compliant, a message is displayed that directs the user to the web portal, or the company portal app where they can find information about the problem and how to remediate it.
segment.target: If the device is not compliant, a message is displayed that directs the user to the web portal, or the company portal app where they can find information about the problem and how to remediate it.

segment.source: For PCs:
segment.target: For PCs:

segment.source: If the conditional access policy requirement is to allow domain joined or compliant, a message with instructions about how to enroll the device is displayed.
segment.target: If the conditional access policy requirement is to allow domain joined or compliant, a message with instructions about how to enroll the device is displayed.

segment.source: If the PC does not meet either of the requirements, the user will be asked to enroll the device with .
segment.target: If the PC does not meet either of the requirements, the user will be asked to enroll the device with .

segment.source: If the conditional access policy requirement is set to allow only domain joined windows devices, the device is blocked and a message to contact the IT admin is displayed.
segment.target: If the conditional access policy requirement is set to allow only domain joined windows devices, the device is blocked and a message to contact the IT admin is displayed.

segment.source: You can block access to Exchange email from the devices built-in Exchange ActiveSync email client on the following platforms:
segment.target: You can block access to Exchange email from the devices built-in Exchange ActiveSync email client on the following platforms:

segment.source: Android 4.0 and later, Samsung Knox Standard 4.0 and later
segment.target: Android 4.0 and later, Samsung Knox Standard 4.0 and later

segment.source: iOS 7.1 and later
segment.target: iOS 7.1 and later

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and later
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and later

segment.source: The Mail application on Windows 8.1 and later
segment.target: The Mail application on Windows 8.1 and later

segment.source: Outlook app for iOS and Android, and Outlook desktop 2013 is supported for Exchange Online only.
segment.target: Outlook app for iOS and Android, and Outlook desktop 2013 is supported for Exchange Online only.

segment.source: Step 1: Evaluate the effect of the conditional access policy
segment.target: Step 1: Evaluate the effect of the conditional access policy

segment.source: If you have configured a connection between and Exchange by using the Microsoft Intune service to service connector or the on-premises Exchange connector, you can use the Mobile Device Inventory Reports to identify EAS mail clients that will be blocked from accessing Exchange after you configure the conditional access policy.
segment.target: If you have configured a connection between and Exchange by using the Microsoft Intune service to service connector or the on-premises Exchange connector, you can use the Mobile Device Inventory Reports to identify EAS mail clients that will be blocked from accessing Exchange after you configure the conditional access policy.

segment.source: In the report parameters, select the group you want to evaluate and, if required, the device platforms to which the policy will apply.
segment.target: In the report parameters, select the group you want to evaluate and, if required, the device platforms to which the policy will apply.

segment.source: For more information about how to run reports, see Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports.
segment.target: For more information about how to run reports, see Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports.

segment.source: After you run the report, examine these four columns to determine whether a user will be blocked:
segment.target: After you run the report, examine these four columns to determine whether a user will be blocked:

segment.source: Management Channel – Indicates whether the device is managed by Intune, Exchange ActiveSync, or both.
segment.target: Management Channel – Indicates whether the device is managed by Intune, Exchange ActiveSync, or both.

segment.source: AAD Registered – Indicates whether the device is registered with Azure Active Directory (known as Workplace Join).
segment.target: AAD Registered – Indicates whether the device is registered with Azure Active Directory (known as Workplace Join).

segment.source: Compliant – Indicates whether the device is compliant with any compliance policies you deployed.
segment.target: Compliant – Indicates whether the device is compliant with any compliance policies you deployed.

segment.source: Exchange ActiveSync ID – iOS and Android devices are required to have their Exchange ActiveSync ID associated with the device registration record in Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: Exchange ActiveSync ID – iOS and Android devices are required to have their Exchange ActiveSync ID associated with the device registration record in Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: This happens when the user clicks the Activate Email link in the quarantine email.
segment.target: This happens when the user clicks the Activate Email link in the quarantine email.

segment.source: Windows Phone devices always display a value in this column.
segment.target: Windows Phone devices always display a value in this column.

segment.source: Devices that are part of a targeted group will be blocked from accessing Exchange unless the column values match those listed in the following table:
segment.target: Devices that are part of a targeted group will be blocked from accessing Exchange unless the column values match those listed in the following table:

segment.source: Management channel
segment.target: Management channel

segment.source: AAD registered
segment.target: AAD registered

segment.source: Compliant
segment.target: Compliant

segment.source: Exchange ActiveSync ID
segment.target: Exchange ActiveSync ID

segment.source: Resulting action
segment.target: Resulting action

segment.source: Managed by Microsoft Intune and Exchange ActiveSync
segment.target: Managed by Microsoft Intune and Exchange ActiveSync

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: A value is displayed
segment.target: A value is displayed

segment.source: Email access allowed
segment.target: Email access allowed

segment.source: Any other value
segment.target: Any other value

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No value is displayed
segment.target: No value is displayed

segment.source: Email access blocked
segment.target: Email access blocked

segment.source: You can export the contents of the report and use the Email Address column to help you inform users that they will be blocked.
segment.target: You can export the contents of the report and use the Email Address column to help you inform users that they will be blocked.

segment.source: Step 2: Configure user groups for the conditional access policy
segment.target: Step 2: Configure user groups for the conditional access policy

segment.source: You target conditional access policies to different groups of users depending on the policy types.
segment.target: You target conditional access policies to different groups of users depending on the policy types.

segment.source: These groups contain the users that will be targeted, or exempt from the policy.
segment.target: These groups contain the users that will be targeted, or exempt from the policy.

segment.source: When a user is targeted by a policy, each device they use must be compliant in order to access email.
segment.target: When a user is targeted by a policy, each device they use must be compliant in order to access email.

segment.source: For the Exchange Online policy – to Azure Active Directory security user groups.
segment.target: For the Exchange Online policy – to Azure Active Directory security user groups.

segment.source: You can configure these groups in the Office 365 admin center, or the Intune account portal.
segment.target: You can configure these groups in the Office 365 admin center, or the Intune account portal.

segment.source: For the Exchange On-premises policy – to user groups.
segment.target: For the Exchange On-premises policy – to user groups.

segment.source: You can configure these in the Groups workspace of the console.
segment.target: You can configure these in the Groups workspace of the console.

segment.source: You can specify two group types in each policy:
segment.target: You can specify two group types in each policy:

segment.source: Targeted groups – User groups to which the policy is applied
segment.target: Targeted groups – User groups to which the policy is applied

segment.source: Exempted groups – User groups that are exempt from the policy (optional)
segment.target: Exempted groups – User groups that are exempt from the policy (optional)

segment.source: If a user is in both groups, they will be exempt from the policy.
segment.target: If a user is in both groups, they will be exempt from the policy.

segment.source: Only the groups which are targeted by the conditional access policy are evaluated for Exchange access.
segment.target: Only the groups which are targeted by the conditional access policy are evaluated for Exchange access.

segment.source: Step 3: Configure and deploy a compliance policy
segment.target: Step 3: Configure and deploy a compliance policy

segment.source: Ensure that you have created and deployed a compliance policy to all devices that the Exchange conditional access policy will be targeted to.
segment.target: Ensure that you have created and deployed a compliance policy to all devices that the Exchange conditional access policy will be targeted to.

segment.source: For details about how to configure the compliance policy, see Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details about how to configure the compliance policy, see Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: If you have not deployed a compliance policy and then enable an Exchange conditional access policy, all targeted devices will be allowed access.
segment.target: If you have not deployed a compliance policy and then enable an Exchange conditional access policy, all targeted devices will be allowed access.

segment.source: When you are ready, continue to Step 4.
segment.target: When you are ready, continue to Step 4.

segment.source: Step 4: Configure the conditional access policy
segment.target: Step 4: Configure the conditional access policy

segment.source: For Exchange Online (and tenants in the new Exchange Online Dedicated environment)
segment.target: For Exchange Online (and tenants in the new Exchange Online Dedicated environment)

segment.source: The following flow is used by conditional access policies for Exchange Online to evaluate whether to allow or block devices.
segment.target: The following flow is used by conditional access policies for Exchange Online to evaluate whether to allow or block devices.

segment.source: To access email, the device must:
segment.target: To access email, the device must:

segment.source: Enroll with
segment.target: Enroll with

segment.source: PCs must either be domain joined or be enrolled and compliant with the policies set in .
segment.target: PCs must either be domain joined or be enrolled and compliant with the policies set in .

segment.source: Register the device in Azure Active Directory (this happens automatically when the device is enrolled with .
segment.target: Register the device in Azure Active Directory (this happens automatically when the device is enrolled with .

segment.source: For domain joined PCs, you must set it up to automatically register the device with Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: For domain joined PCs, you must set it up to automatically register the device with Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: Have activated email, which associates the device’s Exchange ActiveSync ID with the device record in Azure Active Directory (applies to iOS and Android devices only).
segment.target: Have activated email, which associates the device’s Exchange ActiveSync ID with the device record in Azure Active Directory (applies to iOS and Android devices only).

segment.source: Be compliant with any deployed compliance policies
segment.target: Be compliant with any deployed compliance policies

segment.source: The device state is stored in Azure Active Directory which grants or blocks access to email, based on the evaluated conditions.
segment.target: The device state is stored in Azure Active Directory which grants or blocks access to email, based on the evaluated conditions.

segment.source: If a condition is not met, the user will be presented with one of the following messages when they log in:
segment.target: If a condition is not met, the user will be presented with one of the following messages when they log in:

segment.source: If the device is not enrolled, or registered in Azure Active Directory, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app and enroll.
segment.target: If the device is not enrolled, or registered in Azure Active Directory, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app and enroll.

segment.source: If the device is not compliant, a message is displayed that directs the user to the web portal where they can find information about the problem and how to remediate it.
segment.target: If the device is not compliant, a message is displayed that directs the user to the web portal where they can find information about the problem and how to remediate it.

segment.source: For a PC:
segment.target: For a PC:

segment.source: If the policy is set to require domain join, and the PC is not domain joined, a message is displayed to contact the IT admin.
segment.target: If the policy is set to require domain join, and the PC is not domain joined, a message is displayed to contact the IT admin.

segment.source: If the policy is set to require domain join or compliant, then the PC does not meet either requirement, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app and enroll.
segment.target: If the policy is set to require domain join or compliant, then the PC does not meet either requirement, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app and enroll.

segment.source: The message is displayed on the device for Exchange Online users and tenants in the new Exchange Online Dedicated environment, and is delivered to the users email inbox for Exchange On-premises and legacy Exchange Online Dedicated devices.
segment.target: The message is displayed on the device for Exchange Online users and tenants in the new Exchange Online Dedicated environment, and is delivered to the users email inbox for Exchange On-premises and legacy Exchange Online Dedicated devices.

segment.source: conditional access rules override, allow, block and quarantine rules that are defined in the Exchange Online admin console.
segment.target: conditional access rules override, allow, block and quarantine rules that are defined in the Exchange Online admin console.

segment.source: To enable the Exchange Online policy
segment.target: To enable the Exchange Online policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Conditional Access > Exchange Online Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Conditional Access > Exchange Online Policy.

segment.source: On the Exchange Online Policy page, select Enable conditional access policy for Exchange Online.
segment.target: On the Exchange Online Policy page, select Enable conditional access policy for Exchange Online.

segment.source: If you check this, the device must be compliant.
segment.target: If you check this, the device must be compliant.

segment.source: If this is not checked then conditional access is not applied.
segment.target: If this is not checked then conditional access is not applied.

segment.source: If you have not deployed a compliance policy and then enable the Exchange Online policy, all targeted devices are reported as compliant.
segment.target: If you have not deployed a compliance policy and then enable the Exchange Online policy, all targeted devices are reported as compliant.

segment.source: Regardless of the compliance state, all users who are targeted by the policy will be required to enroll their devices with .
segment.target: Regardless of the compliance state, all users who are targeted by the policy will be required to enroll their devices with .

segment.source: Under Device platforms, you can choose to apply conditional access policy to:
segment.target: Under Device platforms, you can choose to apply conditional access policy to:

segment.source: All platforms
segment.target: All platforms

segment.source: This will require that any device used to access Exchange Online, to be enrolled in Intune and compliant with the policies.
segment.target: This will require that any device used to access Exchange Online, to be enrolled in Intune and compliant with the policies.

segment.source: Any client application using modern authentication is subject to the conditional access policy, and if the platform is currently not supported by Intune, access to Exchange Online is blocked.
segment.target: Any client application using modern authentication is subject to the conditional access policy, and if the platform is currently not supported by Intune, access to Exchange Online is blocked.

segment.source: Specific platforms
segment.target: Specific platforms

segment.source: If you choose the Specific platforms option, you will see a list of platforms that you can individually select.
segment.target: If you choose the Specific platforms option, you will see a list of platforms that you can individually select.

segment.source: Conditional access policy will apply to any client app that is using modern authentication, but only on the device platforms you select.
segment.target: Conditional access policy will apply to any client app that is using modern authentication, but only on the device platforms you select.

segment.source: Modern authentication brings Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL)-based sign in to Office clients.
segment.target: Modern authentication brings Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL)-based sign in to Office clients.

segment.source: The ADAL based authentication enables Office clients to engage in browser-based authentication (also known as passive authentication).
segment.target: The ADAL based authentication enables Office clients to engage in browser-based authentication (also known as passive authentication).

segment.source: To authenticate, the user is directed to a sign-in web page.
segment.target: To authenticate, the user is directed to a sign-in web page.

segment.source: This new sign-in method enables new scenarios such as, conditional access, based on device compliance and whether multi-factor authentication was performed.
segment.target: This new sign-in method enables new scenarios such as, conditional access, based on device compliance and whether multi-factor authentication was performed.

segment.source: This article has more detailed information on how modern authentication works.
segment.target: This article has more detailed information on how modern authentication works.

segment.source: For windows PCs, the PC must either be domain joined, or enrolled with and compliant.
segment.target: For windows PCs, the PC must either be domain joined, or enrolled with and compliant.

segment.source: You can set the following requirements:
segment.target: You can set the following requirements:

segment.source: Devices must be domain joined or compliant.
segment.target: Devices must be domain joined or compliant.

segment.source: This means that the PCs must either be domain joined or compliant with the policies set in .
segment.target: This means that the PCs must either be domain joined or compliant with the policies set in .

segment.source: If the PC does not meet either of these requirements, the user is prompted to enroll the device with .
segment.target: If the PC does not meet either of these requirements, the user is prompted to enroll the device with .

segment.source: Devices must be domain joined.
segment.target: Devices must be domain joined.

segment.source: This means that the PCs must be domain joined to access Exchange Online.
segment.target: This means that the PCs must be domain joined to access Exchange Online.

segment.source: If the PC is not domain joined access to email is blocked and the user is prompted to contact the IT admin.
segment.target: If the PC is not domain joined access to email is blocked and the user is prompted to contact the IT admin.

segment.source: Devices must be compliant.
segment.target: Devices must be compliant.

segment.source: This means that the PCs must be enrolled in and compliant.
segment.target: This means that the PCs must be enrolled in and compliant.

segment.source: If the PC is not enrolled, a message with instructions on how to enroll is displayed.
segment.target: If the PC is not enrolled, a message with instructions on how to enroll is displayed.

segment.source: Under Exchange ActiveSync mail apps, you can choose to block email from accessing Exchange Online if the device is noncompliant, and select whether to allow or block access to email when Microsoft Intune cannot manage the device.
segment.target: Under Exchange ActiveSync mail apps, you can choose to block email from accessing Exchange Online if the device is noncompliant, and select whether to allow or block access to email when Microsoft Intune cannot manage the device.

segment.source: Under Targeted Groups, select the Active Directory security groups of users to which the policy will apply.
segment.target: Under Targeted Groups, select the Active Directory security groups of users to which the policy will apply.

segment.source: You can either choose to target all users or a selected list of user groups.
segment.target: You can either choose to target all users or a selected list of user groups.

segment.source: For users that are in the Targeted groups, the Intune polices will replace Exchange rules and policies.
segment.target: For users that are in the Targeted groups, the Intune polices will replace Exchange rules and policies.

segment.source: Exchange will only enforce Exchange allow, block and quarantine rules, and Exchange policies if:
segment.target: Exchange will only enforce Exchange allow, block and quarantine rules, and Exchange policies if:

segment.source: The user is not licensed for Intune.
segment.target: The user is not licensed for Intune.

segment.source: The user is licensed for Intune, but the user does not belong to any security groups targeted in the conditional access policy.
segment.target: The user is licensed for Intune, but the user does not belong to any security groups targeted in the conditional access policy.

segment.source: Under Exempted Groups, select the Active Directory security groups of users that are exempt from this policy.
segment.target: Under Exempted Groups, select the Active Directory security groups of users that are exempt from this policy.

segment.source: If a user is in both the targeted and exempted groups, they will be exempt from the policy.
segment.target: If a user is in both the targeted and exempted groups, they will be exempt from the policy.

segment.source: When you are done, click Save.
segment.target: When you are done, click Save.

segment.source: You do not have to deploy the conditional access policy, it takes effect immediately.
segment.target: You do not have to deploy the conditional access policy, it takes effect immediately.

segment.source: After a user creates an email account, the device is blocked immediately.
segment.target: After a user creates an email account, the device is blocked immediately.

segment.source: If a blocked user enrolls the device with (or remediates noncompliance), email access is unblocked within 2 minutes.
segment.target: If a blocked user enrolls the device with (or remediates noncompliance), email access is unblocked within 2 minutes.

segment.source: If the user un-enrolls their device, email is blocked after around 24 hours.
segment.target: If the user un-enrolls their device, email is blocked after around 24 hours.

segment.source: For Exchange on-premises (and tenants in the legacy Exchange Online Dedicated environment)
segment.target: For Exchange on-premises (and tenants in the legacy Exchange Online Dedicated environment)

segment.source: The following flow is used by conditional access policies for Exchange on-premises and tenants in the legacy Exchange Online Dedicated environment to evaluate whether to allow or block devices.
segment.target: The following flow is used by conditional access policies for Exchange on-premises and tenants in the legacy Exchange Online Dedicated environment to evaluate whether to allow or block devices.

segment.source: To enable the Exchange On-premises policy
segment.target: To enable the Exchange On-premises policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Conditional Access > Exchange On-premises policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Conditional Access > Exchange On-premises policy.

segment.source: Configure the policy with the settings you require:
segment.target: Configure the policy with the settings you require:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Block email apps from accessing Exchange On-premises if the device is noncompliant or not enrolled to Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Block email apps from accessing Exchange On-premises if the device is noncompliant or not enrolled to Microsoft Intune

segment.source: When you select this option, devices that are not managed by or are not compliant with a compliance policy that was deployed to them are blocked from accessing Exchange services unless they have been defined as exempt.
segment.target: When you select this option, devices that are not managed by or are not compliant with a compliance policy that was deployed to them are blocked from accessing Exchange services unless they have been defined as exempt.

segment.source: Default rule override - Always allow enrolled and compliant devices to access Exchange
segment.target: Default rule override - Always allow enrolled and compliant devices to access Exchange

segment.source: When you check this option, devices that are enrolled in Intune and compliant with the compliant policies are allowed to access Exchange.
segment.target: When you check this option, devices that are enrolled in Intune and compliant with the compliant policies are allowed to access Exchange.

segment.source: This rule overrides the Default Rule, which means that even if you set the Default Rule to quarantine or block access, enrolled and compliant devices will still be able to access Exchange.
segment.target: This rule overrides the Default Rule, which means that even if you set the Default Rule to quarantine or block access, enrolled and compliant devices will still be able to access Exchange.

segment.source: Targeted Groups
segment.target: Targeted Groups

segment.source: Select the user groups that must enroll their device with before they can access Exchange.
segment.target: Select the user groups that must enroll their device with before they can access Exchange.

segment.source: Exempted Groups
segment.target: Exempted Groups

segment.source: Select the user groups that are exempt from the conditional access policy.
segment.target: Select the user groups that are exempt from the conditional access policy.

segment.source: Settings in this list override those in the Targeted Groups list.
segment.target: Settings in this list override those in the Targeted Groups list.

segment.source: Platform Exceptions
segment.target: Platform Exceptions

segment.source: Click Add Rule to configure a rule that defines access levels for specified mobile device families and models.
segment.target: Click Add Rule to configure a rule that defines access levels for specified mobile device families and models.

segment.source: Because these devices can be of any type, you can also configure device types that are unsupported by .
segment.target: Because these devices can be of any type, you can also configure device types that are unsupported by .

segment.source: Default Rule
segment.target: Default Rule

segment.source: For a device that is not covered by any of the other rules, you can choose to allow it to access Exchange, block it, or quarantine it.
segment.target: For a device that is not covered by any of the other rules, you can choose to allow it to access Exchange, block it, or quarantine it.

segment.source: When you set the rule to allow access, for devices that are enrolled and compliant, email access is granted automatically for iOS, Windows, and Samsung Knox devices.
segment.target: When you set the rule to allow access, for devices that are enrolled and compliant, email access is granted automatically for iOS, Windows, and Samsung Knox devices.

segment.source: The end-user does not have to go through any process to get their email.
segment.target: The end-user does not have to go through any process to get their email.

segment.source: On Android devices that are not Knox based, end-users will get a quarantine email which includes a guided walkthrough to verify enrollment and compliance before they can access email.
segment.target: On Android devices that are not Knox based, end-users will get a quarantine email which includes a guided walkthrough to verify enrollment and compliance before they can access email.

segment.source: If you set the rule to block access or quarantine it, all devices are blocked from getting access to exchange regardless of whether they are already enrolled in Intune or not.
segment.target: If you set the rule to block access or quarantine it, all devices are blocked from getting access to exchange regardless of whether they are already enrolled in Intune or not.

segment.source: To prevent enrolled and compliant devices from being affected by this rule, check the Default Rule Override.
segment.target: To prevent enrolled and compliant devices from being affected by this rule, check the Default Rule Override.

segment.source: If you intention is to first block all devices before granting access to email, checking the Block access, or Quarantine rule can be useful.
segment.target: If you intention is to first block all devices before granting access to email, checking the Block access, or Quarantine rule can be useful.

segment.source: The default rule will apply to all device types, so device types you configure as platform exceptions and that are unsupported by are also affected.
segment.target: The default rule will apply to all device types, so device types you configure as platform exceptions and that are unsupported by are also affected.

segment.source: User Notification
segment.target: User Notification

segment.source: In addition to the notification email sent from Exchange, Intune sends an email that you can configure which contains steps to unblock the device.
segment.target: In addition to the notification email sent from Exchange, Intune sends an email that you can configure which contains steps to unblock the device.

segment.source: You can edit the default message and use HTML tags to format how the text appears.
segment.target: You can edit the default message and use HTML tags to format how the text appears.

segment.source: Because the Intune notification email containing remediation instructions is delivered to the user’s Exchange mailbox, in the event that the user’s device gets blocked before they receive the email message, they can use an unblocked device or other method to access Exchange and view the message.
segment.target: Because the Intune notification email containing remediation instructions is delivered to the user’s Exchange mailbox, in the event that the user’s device gets blocked before they receive the email message, they can use an unblocked device or other method to access Exchange and view the message.

segment.source: This is especially true when the Default Rule is set to block or quarantine.
segment.target: This is especially true when the Default Rule is set to block or quarantine.

segment.source: In this case, the end-user will have to go to their app store, download the Microsoft Company Portal app and enroll their device.
segment.target: In this case, the end-user will have to go to their app store, download the Microsoft Company Portal app and enroll their device.

segment.source: This is applicable to iOS, Windows, and Samsung Knox devices.
segment.target: This is applicable to iOS, Windows, and Samsung Knox devices.

segment.source: For Android devices that are not Knox-based, the IT admin will need to send the quarantine email to an alternate email account, which then the end-user has to copy to their blocked device to complete the enrollment and compliance process.
segment.target: For Android devices that are not Knox-based, the IT admin will need to send the quarantine email to an alternate email account, which then the end-user has to copy to their blocked device to complete the enrollment and compliance process.

segment.source: In order for Exchange to be able to send the notification email, you must configure the account that will be used to send the notification email.
segment.target: In order for Exchange to be able to send the notification email, you must configure the account that will be used to send the notification email.

segment.source: For details, see Configure Microsoft Intune on-premises connector for on-premises or hosted Exchange.
segment.target: For details, see Configure Microsoft Intune on-premises connector for on-premises or hosted Exchange.

segment.source: When you are done, click Save.
segment.target: When you are done, click Save.

segment.source: You do not have to deploy the conditional access policy, it takes effect immediately.
segment.target: You do not have to deploy the conditional access policy, it takes effect immediately.

segment.source: After a user sets up an Exchange ActiveSync profile, it might take from 1-3 hours for the device to be blocked (if it is not managed by ).
segment.target: After a user sets up an Exchange ActiveSync profile, it might take from 1-3 hours for the device to be blocked (if it is not managed by ).

segment.source: If a blocked user then enrolls the device with (or remediates noncompliance), email access will be unblocked within 2 minutes.
segment.target: If a blocked user then enrolls the device with (or remediates noncompliance), email access will be unblocked within 2 minutes.

segment.source: If the user un-enrolls from it might take from 1-3 hours for the device to be blocked.
segment.target: If the user un-enrolls from it might take from 1-3 hours for the device to be blocked.

segment.source: Step 5: Monitor the compliance and conditional access policies
segment.target: Step 5: Monitor the compliance and conditional access policies

segment.source: To view devices that are blocked from Exchange
segment.target: To view devices that are blocked from Exchange

segment.source: On the dashboard, click the Blocked Devices from Exchange tile to show the number of blocked devices and links to more information.
segment.target: On the dashboard, click the Blocked Devices from Exchange tile to show the number of blocked devices and links to more information.

segment.source: Example Scenarios
segment.target: Example Scenarios

segment.source: All iOS devices that access Exchange On-premises must be managed by Intune
segment.target: All iOS devices that access Exchange On-premises must be managed by Intune

segment.source: In this example, the organization only uses devices that run iOS and they require that all of these devices are managed by before they can access Exchange.
segment.target: In this example, the organization only uses devices that run iOS and they require that all of these devices are managed by before they can access Exchange.

segment.source: To accomplish this, in the conditional access policy, they configure the following:
segment.target: To accomplish this, in the conditional access policy, they configure the following:

segment.source: Select the option Enable conditional access policy for Exchange Online.
segment.target: Select the option Enable conditional access policy for Exchange Online.

segment.source: For apps using modern authentication, select iOS for the platform
segment.target: For apps using modern authentication, select iOS for the platform

segment.source: For Exchange ActiveSync apps, select Require mobile devices to be compliant and block access to email on devices that are not supported by .
segment.target: For Exchange ActiveSync apps, select Require mobile devices to be compliant and block access to email on devices that are not supported by .

segment.source: A platform exception that allows devices that run iOS to access Exchange.
segment.target: A platform exception that allows devices that run iOS to access Exchange.

segment.source: A default rule that specifies when a device is not covered by other rules, then it should be blocked.
segment.target: A default rule that specifies when a device is not covered by other rules, then it should be blocked.

segment.source: The following flow is used to decide which devices can access Exchange:
segment.target: The following flow is used to decide which devices can access Exchange:

segment.source: No Android devices can access Exchange On-premises.
segment.target: No Android devices can access Exchange On-premises.

segment.source: All other devices that access Exchange must be managed by Intune
segment.target: All other devices that access Exchange must be managed by Intune

segment.source: In this example, the organization does not want to allow devices that run Android access to Exchange.
segment.target: In this example, the organization does not want to allow devices that run Android access to Exchange.

segment.source: All other supported devices can access Exchange as long as they are managed by .
segment.target: All other supported devices can access Exchange as long as they are managed by .

segment.source: To accomplish this, in the conditional access policy, they configure the following:
segment.target: To accomplish this, in the conditional access policy, they configure the following:

segment.source: Select the option Enable conditional access policy for Exchange online.
segment.target: Select the option Enable conditional access policy for Exchange online.

segment.source: A platform exception that blocks devices that run Android from accessing Exchange.
segment.target: A platform exception that blocks devices that run Android from accessing Exchange.

segment.source: A default rule that specifies when a device is not covered by other rules, then it should be allowed.
segment.target: A default rule that specifies when a device is not covered by other rules, then it should be allowed.

segment.source: The following flow is used to decide which devices can access Exchange:
segment.target: The following flow is used to decide which devices can access Exchange:

segment.source: Block users of noncompliant devices from Exchange Online in a specified Active Directory security group.
segment.target: Block users of noncompliant devices from Exchange Online in a specified Active Directory security group.

segment.source: Exempt devices in another security group
segment.target: Exempt devices in another security group

segment.source: In this scenario, all users in the Accounting Active Directory security group must be blocked from accessing Exchange Online if their device is not compliant with a compliance policy you deployed.
segment.target: In this scenario, all users in the Accounting Active Directory security group must be blocked from accessing Exchange Online if their device is not compliant with a compliance policy you deployed.

segment.source: Additionally, any users in the Finance Active Directory security group must be exempt from the policy, even if they are also in the Accounting security group.
segment.target: Additionally, any users in the Finance Active Directory security group must be exempt from the policy, even if they are also in the Accounting security group.

segment.source: Finally, if any users exist in this group whose devices are not supported by , they must be blocked from accessing Exchange Online on that device.
segment.target: Finally, if any users exist in this group whose devices are not supported by , they must be blocked from accessing Exchange Online on that device.

segment.source: To accomplish this, in the conditional access policy, they configure the following:
segment.target: To accomplish this, in the conditional access policy, they configure the following:

segment.source: Select the option Enable conditional access for Exchange Online..
segment.target: Select the option Enable conditional access for Exchange Online..

segment.source: Select Accounting under Targeted Groups.
segment.target: Select Accounting under Targeted Groups.

segment.source: Select Finance under Exempted Groups.
segment.target: Select Finance under Exempted Groups.

segment.source: Under Exchange ActiveSync mail apps, select Require mobile devices to be compliantoption.
segment.target: Under Exchange ActiveSync mail apps, select Require mobile devices to be compliantoption.

segment.source: The following flow is used to decide which devices can access Exchange:
segment.target: The following flow is used to decide which devices can access Exchange:
